intro: Triumfetta excisa, commonly known as the narrowleaf triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb or shrub, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
